sections.heading: Overview
content:
Harold S. Koplewicz, MD, is director and founder of the New York University
Child Study Center and director of the division of child and adolescent
psychiatry at New York University Medical Center and Bellevue Hospital Center.
He also serves as professor of clinical psychiatry and pediatrics and vice
chairman of the department of psychiatry at the New York University School of
Medicine. Koplewicz is a nationally renowned child and adolescent psychiatrist
and the recipient of many awards, including the 1997 Exemplary Psychiatrist
Award from the National Alliance for the Mentally Ill and the Rieger Service
Award from the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry. Koplewicz
is co-editor of "Childhood Revealed: Art Expressing Pain, Discovery and
Hope" and author of "It's Nobody's Fault: New Hope for Difficult
Children and Their Parents." He has appeared on numerous TV programs,
including "Oprah," "20/20," and "Today."
